alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Outagamie; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 08 at 2:15PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH HEAVY RAIN WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BROWN...SOUTHWESTERN KEWAUNEE...NORTHWESTERN CALUMET...NORTHEASTERN WINNEBAGO AND SOUTHEASTERN OUTAGAMIE COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM CST... At 210 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms from northeast Winnebago County to Appleton to De Pere to Casco, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Urban flooding and minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... De Pere, Appleton, Oshkosh, Menasha, Kaukauna, Little Chute, Kimberly, Luxemburg, Denmark, and Northern Lake Winnebago. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding in urban areas, especially where storm drains are clogged with fallen leaves. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
